description.p: A Class_of_connection_of_activity specifies a mapping between classes of activity that indicates there are connection relationships between members of the two mapped classes. A connection relationship indicates that there is a flow of matter, energy or information.
The nature of a connection between individual activities may be specified by indicating a class_of_connection_of_activity of which it is a member.

ul.li: the class of activity 'maintain mechanical equipment'; and
the class of activity 'operate mechanical equipment',

example.p: that indicates there is a flow of material objects, documents and information in both directions between the two activities, is a class_of_connection_of_activity.
The cardinality for this relationship is follows:

ul.li: a maintain mechanical equipment activity is connected to zero one or many operate mechanical equipment activities;
an operate mechanical equipment activity is connected to one or many maintain mechanical equipment activities.

description.note: The cardinality for the relationship is within the scope of the Cardinality_of_relationship application module.
This entity is identical to class_of_connection_of_individual in ISO 15926-2, where the relationship is between classes of activity.

explicit.name: related_activity
explicit.description: the Class_of_activity that has members as side 1 of the connection.

explicit.name: relating_activity
explicit.description: the Class_of_activity that has members as side 2 of the connection.
